titleStmt.title: A generall advertisement for the better observing and keeping of our monthly fast, commanded by His Majesty and both Houses of Parlimeut [sic]. And for the better ordering of innes, tavernes, ale-houses, and all manner victualling houses, and the like. That thereby this fast being kept from all manner of disorder, wee may happily attaine to true peace and quietnesse, and the grace of God, for which it was instituted.

A generall advertisement for the better observing and keeping of our monthly fast, commanded by His Majesty and both Houses of Parlimeut [sic]. And for the better ordering of innes, tavernes, ale-houses, and all manner victualling houses, and the like. That thereby this fast being kept from all manner of disorder, wee may happily attaine to true peace and quietnesse, and the grace of God, for which it was instituted.

publicationStmt.publisher: Novemb. 28. London, Printed for John Hanson,

notesStmt.note: Possibly another edition of Wing E1550.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
